description: I am an Assistant Golf Professional (B-8) Level 1 Apprentice striving for Class A membership in the near future. I currently provide pro shop operations support at Hidden Falls Golf Club. I use the FORE Reservations software to schedules tee times and process payments, manage sales and update inventory controls. I also assist patrons with the proper selection of golf equipment and merchandise. I provide golf instruction to interested patrons. I promote and schedule golf events and tournaments. I provide guidance to all guests concerning course safety rules and regulations. I provide professional telephone support while taking reservations and messages. Additionally, I perform opening and end-of-day functions to include tallying daily receipts and closing/securing the facility. I provide visual and physical upgrades to the facility throughout the day and ensure that all areas are presentable at all times. I manage and update club handicaps using the GHIN management tools and am currently the Handicap Chairmen for Austin Area #7875 - US Handicap Golf Association (GolfNet - Online service). During the day, I am also the course starter and course marshal.

description: Completde an Associate’s Degree in Golf Course Operations and Management for a career in the golf industry. Studying both golf course management and professional golf instruction. The Golf Course Operations and Management degree program includes courses such as Verbal Communications, Business Law, Accounting, Financial Management, Fundamentals of Business, Marketing, Advertising, Promotions, Sales and Business Writing. Professional Golf instruction covers Golf Fundamentals, Mechanics of the Short Game, and Advanced Elements of the Short Game, Golf Club Fitting, Golf Club Repair, Methods of Teaching and Advanced Teaching. These courses coupled with History, Rules, Golf Operation courses, Essentials of Food Service, Planning and Organizing Tournament Golf, Golf Course Maintenance and Tournament Administration provide thorough preparation to manage a golf facility.

description: Performed the role of site Program Manager/Project Coordinator in support of Performance Based Navigation (PBN) contract. Independently developed and managed project deadlines and milestones tracking mechanism to meet time sensitive deliverables. Developed and collaborated with a software development and implementation team in the construction, development, and adaptation of a web secure self-sustained record document management system software application for use by domestic and international aviation entities. Authored, coordinated, tracked, and created monthly status reports (MSR) of Cockpit Advanced Vision Systems (EVS) and Wake Turbulence initiatives. Created and coordinated a feedback instrument for all flight crews participating in Flight Simulator multi-crew simulations to ensure evaluation of customer progress, issues and problems, and prepare interim and final reports to be used to evaluate the overall effectiveness of Flight Simulator training scenarios. Researched, investigated, and created a software beta version of a Satellite Based Augmentation System (SBAS) Channel Allocation system. Designed a state-of-the-art, technological cryptologic deployable aeronautical electronic flight bag technical kit (TECHKIT) for theatre and national level pilots and aircrews. Recognized as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) by providing in-depth data collection expertise and research analysis within FAA Flight Technologies Procedures Division. Examined, created, and authored cryptologic analysis technical course curriculum concentrating on airborne platforms. As a member of technical training course reevaluation team, Provided project management expertise during the update of FAA Flight Operations Simulation and Analysis Branch FY 2013 Flight Simulator Availability; Flight Simulator Training Device time to participate in Next Generation studies, FAA Academy training, and other activities in direct support of Destination 2025 goals. .

description: • Provided all-source analytical support to the Defense Intelligence Agency. Used behavioral science methodologies to prepare all-source analytical assessments of foreign leader decision making processes in support of information operations planning, policy, and execution. Conducted open source and classified research to support creation of three times the required number of intelligence products, while maintaining high quality writing and analysis. • Developed and maintained relationships with analysts and collectors throughout the intelligence community; briefed customers on capabilities, collaborated on intelligence products, and regularly attended analytical and academic conferences at a rate well beyond the minimum requirements. • Developed collection requirements to address gaps in collection. Wrote over two times the required number of intelligence report evaluations to ensure collection requirements were satisfied. Trained and mentored new employees on analytical methodology. • Managed the team that developed a BAE-internal course on exploiting social media for intelligence purposes and taught first iteration of the course. Involved in course development for the BAE-internal introduction to Counterintelligence and Human Intelligence course. Coordinated new employee on-boarding for contract and sponsored new employees. • Received outstanding achievement and high performance awards for consistently exceeding standards in quality and timeliness of deliverables.

Screened HUMINT sources and documents. Prepared appropriate intelligence reports such as Intelligence Information Reports, Contact Reports, and Communication Plans. Conducted liaison with US, Coalition, and foreign intelligence agencies. • Aug. 2005 – Dec. 2011: Counterintelligence Special Agent. Conducted CI investigative activity including interviewing, evidence processing, and preparing and disseminating investigative reporting through approved channels. Provided CI support to force protection, anti-terrorism, and information operations. Participated in CI Force Protection Source Operations. Collected, organized, and analyzed intelligence data in order to produce and maintain CI analytical products. Maintained CI files and databases. Conducted liaison with US, Coalition, and foreign agencies. Applied fundamentals of military and intelligence law. Provided CI/HUMINT support for multidiscipline intelligence products. Prepared counterintelligence reports and estimates. • Dec. 2003 – Dec. 2011: All Source Intelligence Analyst. Used a variety of analytical methods to prepare all-source intelligence products to support the combat commander. Assisted in determining the significance and reliability of incoming information.

description: • Provided instructional and writing support to the U.S. Army Counterintelligence (CI) and Human Intelligence (HUMINT) Operations Management course at Fort Huachuca, AZ. Taught CI and HUMINT operations management to mid- and senior-level U.S. military personnel. Designed and updated training curricula. • Researched, wrote, and presented CI management curriculum, including intelligence oversight, source operations, collection management, jurisdiction, investigation, and production. • Taught students to incorporate Priority Intelligence Requirements into development of collection management strategies to best leverage CI and HUMINT assets to fill tactical and strategic level intelligence gaps, taking into consideration other available intelligence collection platforms. • Selected to be senior test control officer to re-conceptualize the testing process and structure using statistical analysis to support and advance curriculum development. • Conducted open-source and classified research to support curriculum development. Advised peers on accurate, realistic incorporation of CI learning points into the curriculum. • Received instructor of the month award for excelling beyond peers in instructional capabilities.
